page.title: 01Stroma
page.content: Stroma is an island in the Pentland Firth 3 kilometers northwest of John O'Groats in Caithness. The island is 3 kilometers long and 1 1/2 -2 kilometers wide. It was inhabited unti the 1960s when its economy declined and it was abandoned. There are several crofts and a school all of which are now derelict. The only inhabitants on Stroma now are 3 lighthouse keepers in the lighhouse at the north of the island at Swilkie Point Access to Stroma is difficult because there is no longer any boat service. This area of the survey covers the central and southern part of Stroma. It covered with derelict crofts near to the road which runs up the middle of island. There is some moorland and peat bogs on the west of island.
